intro: Lasiodiscus fasciculiflorus, commonly known as the clustered-flower lasiodiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks.
